snippet: Inspectors will return to Iran on Feb. 21, suggesting that some common understanding had been reached regarding the country’s position regarding scrutiny of its nuclear program.
abstract: International Atomic Energy Agency says its inspectors, who just completed a three-day visit to Iran, will return there in three weeks, signaling that both sides are seeking ways to defuse rising tensions over Iran's disputed nuclear program.

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Inspectors will return to Iran on Feb. 21, suggesting that some common understanding had been reached regarding the country’s position regarding scrutiny of its nuclear program.

headline.seo: IAEA Nuclear Inspectors to Visit Iran Again in February
headline.main: U.N. Nuclear Monitor Agency Announces Second Visit to Iran
